body.name: DYPER Viscose from Bamboo Baby Diapers Size Newborn + Wipes | Honest Ingredients | Cloth Alternative | Day & Overnight | Made with Plant-Based* Materials | Hypoallergenic for Sensitive Skin, Unscented
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 14 hrs 52 mins
features: KIND TO BABY: Experience plant-based* disposable diapers designed for sensitive newborn, preemie, and toddler skin. Outer and inner layers are made with 100% Viscose from Bamboo for improved comfort, superior wicking, and maximum fluid retention.

STRETCHY, SOFT, COMFORTABLE: Remarkably soft to the touch, absorbent, and thoughtfully made with honest ingredients. They feel more like yoga-pants than conventional diapers with an almost underwear-like fit.

ABSORBENT, SAFE, VERSATILE: Certified to the highest OEKO-TEX consumer safety standards. Clinically tested and 5-star rated by dermatologists. Great as a cloth diaper alternative, for potty training boys & girls, nighttime protection, and swaddler time.

RESPONSIBLE & MADE WITH PLANT-BASED* MATERIALS: Our infant diapers are parent’s choice because they are made without chlorine, latex, alcohol, perfumes, PVC, lotions, TBT, parabens, sulphates, & phthalates. They are unprinted, unscented, hypoallergenic, and cruelty-free to protect the next generation.
Each package contains 76 Size Newborn diapers for babies <10 lb + 1 pack of 60 Wipes

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One of my favorites
reviews.reviewText: I like these diapers for my baby. I tried other diapers when she was newborn and they were too big so she would leak a lot. The scrunch back of these held it in and the plain white style is so cute. They were good on her sensitive skin, and I really loved the wipes and the simple ingredients. The newborn size was perfect but I feel like the size 1s were really close in size to the newborn and she grew out of them so fast I had to give them away

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Found a good one!
reviews.reviewText: I used to switch between Pampers Pure and Honest diapers. And tried some boxes of Huggies Special Delivery, as well. I really like these Dypers. They run a tad bigger than the others. Seem comfy for baby. There’s only been one “pee out” overnight, compared to multiple with other brands. I like the pure white look for my baby. My toddler prefers images, but no big deal. They give a military discount through their website, which is great! Love that quality. The only thing is if a wet-only diaper gets really full by the morning, the smell is a *little* funkier than with the other diapers, but not a real issue. She gets a new diaper, and that one goes in the pail.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love these diapers for my baby girl. They are incredibly soft and very absorbent. They mold to her body well and have never given her a diaper rash. I’ve found that these diapers typically run a little larger than other brands, for example a size 2 in Dyper might be a size 3 in Honest. Would recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Love the texture and materials
reviews.reviewText: We love the unscented materials and texture of these diapers but we do have blow outs that go up the back quite frequently and don’t have this issue with Huggies. We will continue to use these because of the materials but will also mix in other diapers for use in car seats when we know we don’t want a leaky poop diaper

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best disposables for heavy wetters and sensitive skin, hands down!
reviews.reviewText: I will start out saying these are a little pricey, but I knew our baby would need hypoallergenic disposables when she’s not in cloth. No dyes; phlaytes, chlorine or other terrible chemicals. The inner is wood pulp, sustainably sourced I believe and so absorbent and bamboo outer is super soft. These are hands down the best disposable brand we’ve encountered. Subscription service is handy and you get a slight discount I believe sometimes freebies for signing up. Adjustable dates and can return sizes that don’t fit or unused packs. Overall these are the only ones I’ve been completely satisfied. I love these, definitely worth a try. Sizes do run large ( 9lbs could have definitely used the size 1s instead of size 2; now 12-13lbs fitting right getting a little snug in size 2) I would size down 100% if you’re on the fence. Compostable service if you’re down to pay for the shipping. This company purchase carbon offsets which helps reduce the carbon footprint of lovely single use items such as disposable diapers (which there are plenty of in the world). Love the eco friendly, sensitive skin friendly vibes. I have to advocate for cloth diapers from an eco standpoint and would encourage any caregiver who feels up to the task to do the same, but for those times when I need it I use disposable for the sake of my sanity or drs visits, I use these.Tested against:Nest - great but could absorb as much as we needed so leaking happened on a few occasions towards her growing out of size 2 and $$$Bambo Love - leak problems, not a bamboo diaper apparently. Narrow fit; not wide enough for our babe

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars quality diaper with honest ingredients
reviews.reviewText: went through multiple diaper brands for newborn size and most are to large for new born or have harmful ingredients. with this brand we found the perfect medium in quality and size to meet the demands of our newborn. also offer good deals on their website

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Pretty amazing diapers but…
reviews.reviewText: I personally don’t find these diapers to be very soft and they’re rather bulky. They also have a tendency to wear down if worn without clothes. My daughter would crawl in her diapers and there would be bits of the diaper coming off from friction. The diapers are incredibly absorbent though. I would use them for overnight but during the day; I’d pass on these diapers if you have a baby under 1. I think these are perfect diapers for toddlers though. My daughter never had blowouts with these diapers and no diaper rash. It really isn’t worth their price- I’d go with Honest Diapers instead but because they are bamboo and biodegradable; it makes the value a little more because you know you’re helping the environment. I also live in Scottsdale where the DYPER is headquartered at so I like the idea of helping a local business… that being said I don’t know if I will ever buy from them again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars great diapers buy via walmart at half the price
reviews.reviewText: great diapers buy via WALMART at half the price. cheapest place wife found these diapers, not even “discounts” through the company directly come close. we save 50% off their best deals via walmart
